item.title: From one .TXT to the next
item.dc:creator: @mikescott mikescott
item.description:
@mikescott wrote:

Hey peeps, i was just wondering, im trying to make my npc’s not say shop names if players aren’t using the silab client, here is my code if (silabs == true) { if(npcs[j].npcType == 755 && misc.random2(22) == 1) { npcs[j].updateRequired = true; npcs[j].textUpdateRequired = true; npcs[j].textUpdate = "First Silabsoft item shop!"; } else if (silabs == false) { if(npcs[j].npcType == 755 && misc.random2(22) == 1) { npcs[j].updateRequired = true; npcs[j].textUpdateRequired = true; npcs[j].textUpdate = "Silabsoft V4 Client ONLY"; } }

But i get this error NPCHandler.java:992: cannot find symbol symbol : variable silabs location: class NPCHandler if (silabs == true) { ^ NPCHandler.java:998: cannot find symbol symbol : variable silabs location: class NPCHandler } else if (silabs == false) { ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 2 errors Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .

How do i make it pickup a void from client.java?

                                                                 Regards - MikeScott

Read full topic
